<MembersIndexItem

  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie">CallStackTrie</a></>}>
Class to build a trie of call stack contexts for a particular profiled allocation call, along with their associated allocation types. <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<MembersIndexItem
  type="class"
  name={<><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstack">CallStack&lt;NodeT, IteratorT&gt;</a></>}>
Helper class to iterate through stack ids in both metadata (memprof MIB and callsite) and the corresponding ThinLTO summary data structures (<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/callsiteinfo">CallsiteInfo</a> and <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/mibinfo">MIBInfo</a>). <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstack/#details">More...</a>
</MembersIndexItem>

<Link id="l00048" /><CodeLine lineNumber="48"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Class to build a trie of call stack contexts for a particular profiled</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="comment">/// allocation call, along with their associated allocation types.</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie/#aea6085c89d1a32486046c3fcfa61eee0"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie/#aea6085c89d1a32486046c3fcfa61eee0">~CallStackTrie</a>() &#123; deleteTrieNode(Alloc); &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie/#a8764bb32436ceef74c9a8cdfc0da0e28"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie/#a8764bb32436ceef74c9a8cdfc0da0e28">empty</a>()</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword"> const </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> Alloc == </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">; &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add a call stack context with the given allocation type to the Trie.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// The context is represented by the list of stack ids (computed during</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00116" /><CodeLine lineNumber="116"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// matching via a debug location hash), expected to be in order from the</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// allocation call down to the bottom of the call stack (i.e. callee to</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// caller order).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie/#a87d4df64225248afbae4f68c4f9501b1">addCallStack</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a230980cf62b697d22ffdda32f6118e27">AllocationType</a> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/memorybuiltins-cpp/#abb725d65acc814edc5c025fb8ee6d55b">AllocType</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef&lt;uint64&#95;t&gt;</a> StackIds,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><Highlight kind="normal">                    std::vector&lt;ContextTotalSize&gt; ContextSizeInfo = &#123;&#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add the call stack context along with its allocation type from the MIB</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// metadata to the Trie.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie/#a87d4df64225248afbae4f68c4f9501b1">addCallStack</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/mdnode">MDNode</a> &#42;MIB);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Build and attach the minimal necessary MIB metadata. If the alloc has a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// single allocation type, add a function attribute instead. The reason for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// adding an attribute in this case is that it matches how the behavior for</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// allocation calls will be communicated to lib call simplification after</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// cloning or another optimization to distinguish the allocation types,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// which is lower overhead and more direct than maintaining this metadata.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Returns true if memprof metadata attached, false if not (attribute added).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie/#ab9f10c4267af88a1bd143a7260d2ac8f">buildAndAttachMIBMetadata</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42;CI);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// Add an attribute for the given allocation type to the call instruction.</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// If hinted by reporting is enabled, a message is emitted with the given</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><Highlight kind="comment">  /// descriptor used to identify the category of single allocation type.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstacktrie/#a93eab9244b86ce5f52aa4f15a71741be">addSingleAllocTypeAttribute</a>(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/callbase">CallBase</a> &#42;CI, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a230980cf62b697d22ffdda32f6118e27">AllocationType</a> AT,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">                                   <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a> Descriptor);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="comment"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00142" /><CodeLine lineNumber="142"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Helper class to iterate through stack ids in both metadata (memprof MIB and</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><Highlight kind="comment">/// callsite) and the corresponding ThinLTO summary data structures</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00144" /><CodeLine lineNumber="144"><Highlight kind="comment">/// (CallsiteInfo and MIBInfo). This simplifies implementation of client code</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00145" /><CodeLine lineNumber="145"><Highlight kind="comment">/// which doesn&#39;t need to worry about whether we are operating with IR (Regular</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00146" /><CodeLine lineNumber="146"><Highlight kind="comment">/// LTO), or summary (ThinLTO).</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstack"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NodeT, </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> IteratorT&gt; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstack/#a13a0bc8634c573823b8e98cdc5bbbf2e">CallStack</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00148" /><CodeLine lineNumber="148"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00149" /><CodeLine lineNumber="149" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstack/#a13a0bc8634c573823b8e98cdc5bbbf2e"><Highlight kind="normal">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/memprof/callstack/#a13a0bc8634c573823b8e98cdc5bbbf2e">CallStack</a>(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> NodeT &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a> = </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">nullptr</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">) : <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/regcomp-c/#a0240ac851181b84ac374872dc5434ee4">N</a>) &#123;&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00151" /><CodeLine lineNumber="151"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Implement minimum required methods for range-based for loop.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00152" /><CodeLine lineNumber="152"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// The default implementation assumes we are operating on ThinLTO data</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00153" /><CodeLine lineNumber="153"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// structures, which have a vector of StackIdIndices. There are specialized</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00154" /><CodeLine lineNumber="154"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// versions provided to iterate through metadata.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
